meanings.definition: One of the numerous small, finger-like projections of the mucous membrane of the small intestine.
meanings.sent1: The villus helps absorb nutrients in the small intestine.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained how the villi in the small intestine aid in digestion.
meanings.sent3: The villus in the small intestine was so efficient, it could even absorb a tiny toy!
meanings.sent4: Her curiosity was like a villus, always reaching out for new information.
meanings.sent5: The villus waved like a tiny flag, signaling the absorption of nutrients.

meanings.definition: A hairlike process on a cell.
meanings.sent1: Under the microscope, the villus on the cell was clearly visible.
meanings.sent2: The villus on the cell's surface helped in sensory perception.
meanings.sent3: The villus on the cell was so long, it looked like a tiny antenna.
meanings.sent4: His attention to detail was like a villus, picking up every small signal.
meanings.sent5: The villus on the cell swayed gently, sensing the environment around it.
